data.event: Boma was the capital city of the Congo Free State and Belgian Congo (the modern Democratic Republic of the Congo) from 1 May 1886 to 1926, when the capital was moved to LÃ©opoldville (since renamed Kinshasa).
Henry Morton Stanley arrived here on 9 Aug. 1877, after crossing Africa east to west.
In 1884 the people of Boma granted a protectorate of their country to the International Association of the Congo.
